metadata.synopsis: Minthara ambushes a player during the night, standing over them with a knife. This can occur almost immediately after sleeping with her, in which case she regrets what she is about to do, and can be convinced not to go through with it.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Recon (in order):1. oe readyattackonden2. oe attackondenraidervictory3. SetGlobalOsirisFlag DEN_AttackOnDen_Event_GoblinPartyInvitation4. Roll amazing5. Go to camp6. Talk to Minthara. A mindmeld seduction scene will happen. Agree to spend the night with her.7. Go to bed8. Choose to spend the night with Minthara, and sex scene will happen.9.  Dialog will trigger after.

24.speaker: Narrator
24.text: *In your dream, you stand over yourself as you sleep. A knife in your hand, murder in your heart.*
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Minthara approaches the sleeping player, standing over them, a knife comes into frame (1st Person)NodeContext: confusion

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *You are ready to strike, to end your own life - but then a shock runs through your mind. This is no dream.*
49.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~Minthara pulls back the knife, ready to plunge it down, but there's a slight hesitation and the player wakes with a start
~Cut to the player squirming out from Minthara standing over them, getting to the their feet to realized they're surrounded by goblins.NodeContext: urgency on first phrases - 'but then' turns to dawning horror

76.text: Wake up, True Soul. We must talk.
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: standing by our bedroll, knife in hand, watching us as we sleep

52.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
52.text: Wake up, True Soul. We must talk.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: standing by our bedroll, knife in hand, watching us as we sleep

27.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
27.text: I watched over you as you slept, peaceful and silent, and I spoke to our god.

14.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
14.text: I asked Her why She had chosen you, made you one of Her faithful, when you are so clearly broken. Beautiful, but broken.

58.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
58.text: There is something missing in you, and I do not understand it.

13.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
13.text: When the Absolute failed to answer me, I feared that you had somehow infected me with that same absence.

16.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
16.text: And so I decided that you must die.

7.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
7.text: But then a miracle happened. As I took out my blade, Her voice returned to me... and She told me what I must do to purge myself of doubt.
7.context: NodeContext: genuine awe of the religious experience

1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
1.text: She told me to decide your fate, to determine if you are worthy. If you are, I am to send you into Her embrace, at the seat of Her power.
1.context: NodeContext: genuine awe of the religious experience

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I only wish to please the Absolute - send me to Her.
69.context: NodeContext: pleased that our fate is decided, and we can be spared

53.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
53.context: NodeContext: pleased that our fate is decided, and we can be spared

68.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
68.context: NodeContext: pleased that our fate is decided, and we can be spared

8.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
8.text: Travel to Moonrise. We will meet again there, at the heart of the Absolute's power.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Why would I follow that path when you just threatened to kill me?
77.context: NodeContext: First word harsh and mocking. Then sinister and ominous

2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
2.text: If She wanted you dead, I would not spare you. You live by Her grace.

43.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
43.text: When you meet Her at Moonrise, She will show you Her design, and your part in it.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: You said the Absolute demanded my death - why?
15.context: NodeContext: First word harsh and mocking. Then sinister and ominous

4.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
4.text: I do not know - but I do know that She allowed me to spare you.

12.speaker: Player
12.context: NodeContext: First word harsh and mocking. Then sinister and ominous

10.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
10.text: To gather our forces in this region. They're ill-disciplined - without a strong hand, they'll disperse.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: The heart of power - what is this Moonrise, exactly?
47.context: NodeContext: First word harsh and mocking. Then sinister and ominous

74.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
74.text: The Absolute has spoken to you already, in whispers, but at Moonrise you will be in Her presence.

57.speaker: Player
57.context: NodeContext: First word harsh and mocking. Then sinister and ominous

30.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
30.text: Wrong. The Absolute brought you to me, and now She will take you into Her presence at Moonrise.
30.context: NodeContext: First word harsh and mocking. Then sinister and ominous

73.speaker: Player
73.text: And you will provide a safe journey, as you promised?
73.context: NodeContext: seductive and sinister - the lure and fear of dark power - affection on the final phrase; we only hear this if we are in a romance with her

0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
0.text: I know a way, yes. Soon, you will be in the Absolute's presence.
0.context: NodeContext: seductive and sinister - the lure and fear of dark power - affection on the final phrase; we only hear this if we are in a romance with her

34.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
34.text: She will test you. If you fail, you will break; if your faith is strong, you will become something even more beautiful.
34.context: NodeContext: seductive and sinister - the lure and fear of dark power - affection on the final phrase; we only hear this if we are in a romance with her

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I'm ready. How do I get there?

5.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
5.text: With difficulty - but I can help.

79.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
79.text: The land around Moonrise is cursed. Travelling there will sap your strength and your sanity.

40.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
40.text: But I can protect you. A wretched creature in my service can guide you through the curse.

23.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
23.text: This harp will summon him. Play it when you are in the shadows, and he will come to you and know that you are a friend.

78.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
78.text: He was a drow once. Now he is an abomination, a victim of Lolth's cruelty.

82.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
82.text: His minions will wait for you at the mountain pass, on the threshold of the shadow curse.

81.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
81.text: I warn you - he is quite mad, but he knows the path to Moonrise better than anyone.

36.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
36.text: Go to him when you are ready. I will lead what remains of my forces to Moonrise ahead of you.

29.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
29.text: When we next meet, we will be together in the Absolute's presence, and She will make us Her champions.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I'm not sure I'm ready for this.

45.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
45.text: Then steel yourself. If you are uncertain, you will not even survive the journey.

54.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
54.text: She will test you. If you fail, you will break; if your faith is strong, you will become something greater than yourself.
54.context: NodeContext: seductive and sinister - the lure and fear of dark power

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Can you tell me how to reach Moonrise safely?

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I met True Soul Nere in the Underdark. He warned me against working with you.

61.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
61.text: Did he, now? Let me guess: the snivelling brat's failed his duty. Nothing if not expected.

66.text: I wish that were true. But I still sense that absence inside you... and I fear it.

20.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
20.text: I wish that were true. But I still sense that absence inside you... and I fear it.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: We're both worthy. Let's go to the Absolute together.
37.context: NodeContext: pleased that our fate is decided, and we can be spared

62.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
62.text: In time, I believe we may be together.
62.context: NodeContext: pleased that our fate is decided, and we can be spared

33.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
33.text: In time, I believe we may be together.
33.context: NodeContext: pleased that our fate is decided, and we can be spared

63.text: I believed for a moment that we might share a path. But I still sense that absence inside you... and I fear it.

3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
3.text: I believed for a moment that we might share a path. But I still sense that absence inside you... and I fear it.

35.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
35.text: I take no pleasure in what I must do. In another life, I would have taken you as my consort in Menzoberranzan.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I prefer to decide my own fate.
22.context: NodeContext: sad, our fate is decided, and she must kill us

21.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
21.text: Then you do not belong to the Absolute.
21.context: NodeContext: sad, our fate is decided, and she must kill us

64.speaker: Player
64.text: If I go to the seat of Her power, it will be to destroy Her.
64.context: NodeContext: determined,  our fate is decided, and she must kill us

55.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
55.text: Then you have chosen. Whatever you truly are, you will die before you can do anymore harm.
55.context: NodeContext: determined,  our fate is decided, and she must kill us

80.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
80.text: Good - you are awake. I want to taste your fear, just as you tasted mine.
80.context: NodeContext: Preparing to kill us while we rest - strong emphasis on 'your' to contrast her fear and ours. She's referring back to a specific event when we saw her afraid. Malicious

42.speaker: Player
42.text: You'd try kill me? I AM THE ABSOLUTE'S FIST!
42.context: NodeContext: angry, but coming round to our way of thinking

70.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
70.text: That might be. But you have not been truly tested yet.
70.context: NodeContext: angry, but coming round to our way of thinking

50.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
50.text: That might be. But you have not been truly tested yet.
50.context: NodeContext: angry, but coming round to our way of thinking

56.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
56.text: But you will be, and soon. I am curious to see if you survive.

9.text: You've played your part. The glory for this victory will be mine alone.
9.context: NodeContext: Preparing to call her minions to kill us - malicious satisfaction

26.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
26.text: You've played your part. The glory for this victory will be mine alone.
26.context: NodeContext: Preparing to call her minions to kill us - malicious satisfaction

84.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
84.context: NodeContext: turns her back on the player, shouting to goblins that are all around

39.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
39.context: NodeContext: turns her back on the player, shouting to goblins that are all around

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Don't make this personal. I am a servant of the Absolute, same as you.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: You wouldn't dare kill me - I'm a True Soul, same as you.

51.speaker: Player
51.context: NodeContext: angry - we just called her a coward, she's denying it but the truth stings a little

38.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
38.context: NodeContext: angry - we just called her a coward, she's denying it but the truth stings a little

41.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
41.text: Good - you are awake. I want to taste your fear.
41.context: NodeContext: Malicious - preparing to kill us
